title: Bug 7785 - SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: Bug 7785 - SaveAs Forgets the file type. The icon has also changed from the parent java file icon to a generic file icon.
OB:
1) Open an existing java file. 
2) Modify it (e.g., move an existing class). 
3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save Icon. A dialog will come up. 
4) Browse for a valid container location. 
5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested. 
6) Click Ok. 

Observed Behavior: The Navigator has added the file in the specified location, but no file extension is shown.
EB:
The file is saved as a generic file, as opening it will show that the file is opened as plain text.

Expected Behavior: The file should be saved with the same extension as the original, unless explicitly changed.
SR:
To reproduce the bug:
1) Open an existing java file.
2) Make some changes to the file.
3) Click on the 'Save As' icon located next to the Save icon.
4) In the dialog that appears, browse for a valid location to save the file.
5) Type the desired filename, but do not include the file extension.
6) Click the 'OK' button.

Expected Result: The file should be saved with the same extension as the original file, unless a different extension is explicitly specified in the file name during the 'Save As' process.
